intro: Psychotria hypoleuca, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, black berries that are edible but have a mild, bitter taste. Psychotria hypoleuca is often found in understory habitats of tropical forests, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
